Title: Data Engineer
text:
En Arelance sabemos que las personas son el activo más importante dentro de una empresa y por tanto invertimos muchos esfuerzos en buscar los mejores profesionales para nuestros clientes y en ofrecer a nuestros candidatos los mejores proyectos.




En este momento buscamos profesionales con experiencia en desarrollo Python/PySpark




¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Al menos un año de experiencia en desarrollo y mantenimiento de procesos en Pyspark
Desarrollo y mantenimiento de procesos ETLs
Experiencia con Spark PySpark Hive Hadoop HDFS SQL




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Incorporación en un proyecto estable
Contrato indefinido
Acceso a formación
Modalidad de trabajo remoto




Si tienes interés en una gran oportunidad como ésta ¡inscríbete! ¡Queremos conocerte!




data, Python, Spark, PySpark, Hive, Hadoop, HDFS, SQL

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
text:
Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt zur Erweiterung unseres Data Teams einen weiteren Data Engineer.




We are looking to expand our Data Team with an additional Data Engineer who can start as soon as possible.




Aufgaben




Du pflegst und erweiterst unsere Datenpipelines und unser Datawarehouse
Du liebst es, Datenprodukte in Zusammenarbeit mit Datenanalysten und Data Scientists zu entwerfen, zu entwickeln und zu pflegen
Du integrierst neue Datenquellen und restrukturierst unsere aktuellen Datenpipelines, um die Performance und Skalierbarkeit zu verbessern
Du arbeitest mit unseren Data Engineers zusammen, um ein Data Monitoring zu entwickeln, um die Zuverlässigkeit und Qualität unserer Daten zu verbessern
Du arbeitest mit unseren Data Scientists zusammen, um eine Recommendation Engine, die wir von Grund auf neu erstellen, zu erweitern und zu skalieren
You will maintain and expand our data pipelines and our data warehouse
You love to design, develop and maintain data products in collaboration with Data Analysts and Data Scientists
You will Integrate new data sources and restructure our current data pipelines to improve performance and scalability
You will collaborate with our Data Engineers to develop a Data Monitoring system to improve the reliability and quality of our data
You will collaborate with our Data Scientists to expand and scale a Recommendation Engine that we are building from scratch




Qualifikation




3-4 Jahre Erfahrung im Aufbau und der Pflege von Data Warehouses und der Durchführung von Data Modeling
Sehr starke SQL- und Python-Kenntnisse (unser aktueller ETL-Stack besteht aus SQL-Skripten, die von mara-etl ausgeführt werden - einem Python-basierten ETL-Framework)
Du arbeitest gerne im Team und führst Projekte in fokussierten, inkrementellen Schritten durch
fließend Englisch und Deutsch (~B2 für beide ist ausreichend)
3-4 years experience building and maintaining data warehouses and performing data modeling
Very strong SQL and Python skills (our current ETL stack consists of SQL scripts executed by mara-etl, a lightweight Python-based ETL framework)
You enjoy working in a team, and completing projects in focused, incremental steps
Reasonably fluent in English and German (~B2 for both is acceptable)




Benefits




Gesundheit – Wir leben unser Produkt. Daher stellen wir dir ein jährliches Budget für Gesundheitskurse sowie -equipment zur Verfügung
Work-Life-Balance – Du erhältst einen unbefristetet Arbeitsvertrag, 28 Tage Urlaub p.a. + 1 Tag für ehrenamtliche Tätigkeiten, flexible Arbeitszeiten. Ein selbst bestimmtes Hybrid-Arbeitsmodell (remote oder Office) bieten dir die Möglichkeit, einen Ausgleich zwischen Berufs- und Privatleben zu schaffen
Teamspirit – Unser passioniertes Team freut sich schon auf dich. Durch regelmäßige Teamevents stärken wir unsere Bindung und Zusammenarbeit
Health - We are living our product. That is why we offer you a budget to be used for health and fitness courses as well as equipment
Work-Life-Balance - You receive an unlimited contract, 28 days of vacation plus 1 day for community service and flexible working hours. An individual working modell (remote or at the office) offers you the opportunity to find a balance between working and private life.
Team Spirit - Our passionate team is eager to meet you. We strengthen our bond and cooperation through regular team events.

Title: Junior Data Engineer (initiativ)
text:
Dies ist eine INITIATIVBEWERBUNG! Bewirb dich jetzt über talentbase .tech ...




und wähle bis zu 35 Partner-Unternehmen aus, an welche wir dein Profil für eine DATA ENGINEER Stelle weiterleiten.




Aufgaben




Datenextraktion, Transformation und Laden (ETL) von verschiedenen Datenquellen.
Unterstützung bei der Entwicklung und Pflege von Datenpipelines.
Datenspeicherung und -verwaltung in Datenbanken oder Data Warehouses.
Mitarbeit bei der Datentransformation und -bereinigung.
Überwachung und Wartung von Datenverarbeitungsprozessen.





Qualifikation




Programmierkenntnisse in Sprachen wie Python, Java oder Scala
Verständnis der grundlegenden Datenbankkonzepte und -technologien
Erfahrung mit Big-Data-Frameworks wie Hadoop oder Spark
Kenntnisse in der Datenmodellierung und ETL-Prozessen
Vertrautheit mit SQL und grundlegendes Verständnis von NoSQL-Datenbanken
Problemlösungsfähigkeiten und analytisches Denkvermögen
Teamfähigkeit und die Fähigkeit, effektiv in einem dynamischen Umfeld zu arbeiten
Aufmerksamkeit für Detail und Genauigkeit bei der Datenverarbeitung
Grundlegende Kenntnisse in der Arbeit mit Cloud-Plattformen wie AWS, GCP oder Azure





Dies ist eine Stelle von talentbase .tech!




Profil erstellen und Daten ausfüllen
Coole Unternehmen finden
Mit 1-Klick auf deine Traumrolle bewerben.





Achtung: 1-Klick Initiativbewerbungen sind momentan nur für Österreichische und EU-Staatsbürger:innen, sowie Personen mit Sitz in Österreich verfügbar.

Title: Data Analyst
text:
Are you passionate about revolutionizing the field of psychology?




Unobravo is leading the way in Italy with their innovative e-mental care startup, and has provided exceptional online psychotherapy services to over 113,000 people and conducted over 1,6 million therapy sessions with a team of 3,500 therapists.




If you have a "think-outside-the-box" mentality and believe in the power of teamwork to generate exceptional ideas, Unobravo is the ideal company for you to unleash your potential.




We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst obsessed with data quality to join our data team.




You show:




3+ years experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
Strong programming skills in SQL, and other relevant languages.
Experience in the application of descriptive statistics.
Familiarity with Data Visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Quicksight etc.).
Basic knowledge of Python or other scripting language.
Good knowledge of relational and non-relational databases.
Familiarity with Agile methodology - Scrum.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Flexibility and precision.
Availability to work in full remote.




Preferred experience include:




Degree in Mathematics, Physics or other quantitative field.
Curiosity towards the evolutions in the Data field, resourcefulness.




As Data Analyst, you will:




Liasing with other teams to formalize requirements and providing an analytical point of view.
Performing statistical analysis on the available data.
Coming up with the best way to present data to stakeholders.
Providing business insights on the statistical output.
Encroaching into data engineering (ETL, maintain and improve the DWH, setup automatic jobs) tasks if necessary.
Dialogue with the various Unobravo teams to fine-tune both punctual and continuous analyses.
Introducing processes, tools and methodologies in the data use cycle.
Create and review high business value dashboards.
Monitor the quality of the data presented to the end user.
Propose new KPIs for performance monitoring.




Benefit:




100% flexibility & full smart working
A stimulating and growing work environment
Focus on work-life balance
Free online yoga and fitness classes
Discount on psychotherapy sessions




Are you the Unobravo we are looking for? Apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
text:
BARKYN’S VISION




Barkyn delivers health and happiness to pet families around the world.




We are an ambitious, forward thinking startup on a big mission! We’re not only changing the pet market, we’re also reshaping the way the e-commerce experience should feel - human, personalized, seamless, & beautiful. We were considered one of Europe’s Top 100 Startups by Wired, Top Startup by Linkedin, and a success case by Web Summit and the British magazine Monocle.




THE ROLE




We're creating a loved brand in Europe and this is where your story starts!




As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our organization, immersing yourself in data to uncover opportunities for improving our current and future Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Working closely with the product, marketing, and operational teams, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth. Your responsibilities will include developing customized data studio reporting, creating and supporting analytical models, and delivering meaningful information to stakeholders through SQL and business intelligence (BI) tools.




Specifically, we expect you to:




Dive deep into data to identify areas for improvement in our KPIs.
Collaborate closely with product, marketing, and operational teams to deliver valuable insights.
Develop customized data studio reporting for various business areas.
Generate custom reports using SQL and BI tools to provide actionable information to stakeholders.
Create and support analytical models to gain insights into customer behavior.





Mandatory requirements:




Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
2+ years of relevant experience as a Business Analyst or Data Analyst.
Proficiency in SQL.
Experience using data visualization tools such as Data Studio, Looker, PowerBI, Tableau, or similar.
Passion for generating data-driven insights.
Fluency in written and spoken English.





Brownie Points:




Knowledge of statistical programming languages like R and/or Python.
Startup Environment Experience.
Dog Owner.

Title: Software Engineer (Data)
text:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of aweso﻿me products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 30+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 6000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love t﻿urning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.﻿

About The Role

The thing we pride ourselves on at Revolut is how truly data-driven every department of the company is. Data platform engineers are the enablers of this data obsessed culture, providing the infrastructure and tools that power insight generation and decision making for everyone from rank analysts to C-level executives.

In order to tame the exponential growth in size of data and the related complexity, we are looking for the most talented and passionate engineers — great builders and great collaborators.

Think you have what it takes? Let's get in touch 👇

What You’ll Be Doing

Thinking in systems and exploring opportunities to improve and streamline end-to-end processes by transforming abstract concepts into working solutions
Partnering with product owners, engineers, data scientists, and data analysts to develop a seamless data platform
Designing, building, and launching extremely efficient and reliable data infrastructure to move data across a number of platforms including Data Lake and Data Warehouse
Communicating, at scale, through multiple mediums, like dashboards, bots and more
Leveraging data and business principles to solve large scale web, mobile, and data infrastructure problems
Ensuring consistent standards and quality in the data platform ecosystem
Supporting and training new and existing users of the platform
Creating and maintaining a company-wide data registry and documentation
Coming up with and enforcing best practices for coding, testing, deployment, and maintenance
Planning and implementing complex platform changes that involve stakeholders across the whole organisation
Automating and simplifying existing processes to ease life of fellow engineers


What You'll Need

A Bachelor's or Master's in Computer Science or related field (or equivalent industry experience)
Fluency in Python, SQL, Unix Shell
Experience applying agile software development technical practices (TDD, refactoring, CI/CD, XP)
Experience in custom ETL design, implementation, and maintenance
Experience with workflow orchestrators, such as Airflow
Experience working with Big Data/MPP analytics platform (i.e. Exasol, Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, or similar)


Nice to have

Experience building large-scale infrastructure applications
The ability to write easily understandable and maintainable code in multiple programming languages
Experience with commercial cloud providers (e.g. GCP, AWS)
Experience setting up infrastructure as code using Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Helm
Awareness of data quality aspects in data warehousing systems
Experience with SQL performance tuning
Experience with notebook-based data science workflow
Experience building data platforms using Spark, Trino/Presto, Flink, Hive, or similar
Experience with monitoring and logging tools NewRelic, Grafana, Prometheus, ELK
Experience implementing data mesh principles


Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Data Engineer_Automobilbranche (w/m/d) - bundesweit remote
text:
Für den Data Fachbereich von einem namhaften Enterprise-Kunden suchen wir bundesweit:

Cloud Data Engineer (All genders)

Anforderungen

Fundierte Erfahrung im Bereich Data Engineering und/oder Data Analytics
Fundierte Erfahurng in der Programmierung mit Python und SQL
Cloud-Affinität: gutes Knowhow in gängigen Public Cloud oder das Interesse sich in Cloud einzuarbeiten
Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch und fließendes Englisch

Nice To Have

Erste Erfahrung mit CI/CD Pipelines
Relevante Zertifikate oder die Bereitschaft sie abzuschließen
Erfahrung in der Datenvisualisierung und Kommunikation mit Stakeholdern

Worum Es Geht

Das Unternehmen ist einer der führenden IT-Dienstleister im deutschsprachigen Raum. Es unterstützt Kunden aus verschiedenen Branchen bei der Digitalen Transformation, vor allem in Themenfeldern wie AI& Data Analytics, Cloud & Migration, IoT und Software Development. Der Fachbereich Big Data besteht aus 150 Mitarbeitenden und ist verantwortlich für die Umsetzung komplexer Data & Analytics Enterprise-Projekte.

Als (Senior) Data Engineer bist du dafür zuständig:

Erarbeitung von Use Cases für Kunden aus unterschiedlichen Industrien
Umsetzung von Projekten mit Azure/AWS Toolstack und der dabei integrierten Analysesoftware
Implementierung von Data Pipelines im Rahmen von Produktentwicklungen oder Kundenprojekten
Konzeption, technische Architektur und Umsetzung von Cloud-Lösungen: End-to-End von der Ideenfindung über den Proof of Concept bis zur Produktion und kontinuierlichen Verbesserung
Unterstützung des Vertriebs bei Kundenterminen und Anforderungsanalyse
Du entwickelst dich stets technisch und professionell weiter und fördert das Wissen im Team

Dafür Wird Ihnen Geboten

30 Tage Urlaubstage
Agiles modernes Arbeitsumfeld: Remote-Kultur, wenig Reiseanteil
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Homeoffice Möglichkeiten
Tarifvertrag, reines Fixgehalt und dazu noch betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Eine große Anzahl von Weiterbildungs- und Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Bereitstellung von Arbeitszeit und weiterer Ressourcen für Schulungen und Zertifikate
Große langfristige Projekte im Enterprise-Umfeld, vor allem mit Fokus auf Automobilbranche
Teamarbeit bei Kundenprojekten statt Ein-Mann-Armee
Agile Projektarbeit nach Scrum-Ansatz
Unterschiedliche Möglichkeiten, deine Karriere mitzugestalten
Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche und umfangreiches Mentoring

Hiring Prozess

Bewerbung - Erster Austausch mit mir/Han - 2 IVs mit dem Unternehmen/Fachbereich - Angebot/Absage

Bei Rückfragen steht Han CHANG (she/her, Mail: h.chang@frankgroup.com) gerne zur Verfügung.

Impressum - https://www.frankgroup.com/de/impressum/

Title: Junior Data Analyst
text:
Company Name: The Swedish Times- Newbies are welcome to Apply




Job Type: Full-time/Remote




Salary: $4,000.00 - $5,000.00 per month




The Swedish Times is a top online platform for professionals and enthusiasts who want to stay informed about the Swedish business, financial, and tech sectors. We also cover international news related to business and technology. Our goal is to be the go-to place for people who want timely updates and useful information about these industries. Visit The Swedish Times to stay connected and up-to-date with the professional world.




We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in assisting with data analysis tasks, data cleaning, and reporting under the guidance of senior analysts. This is an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience and develop your analytical skills in a professional setting.




If you're interested, we would love to have you join our team! Visit our website at [theswedishtimes dot com] to find out more information. We require you to send us your CV and a cover letter that highlights why you would be a perfect fit for our team. We can't wait to hear from you!




Tasks




Responsibilities:




Assist in collecting, organizing, and cleaning data from various sources.
Visit the website of The Swedish Times [theswedishtimes dot com] to familiarize yourself with the process.
Perform data analysis using statistical techniques and data visualization tools. Support the creation of reports and presentations to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with team members to identify data quality issues and propose solutions.
Help in maintaining and updating data documentation and databases.
Conduct research and stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis.





Requirements




Qualifications:




Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science) or equivalent practical experience.
Basic understanding of data analysis concepts and techniques.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Proficiency in data manipulation and cleaning tasks.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar is a plus.





Benefits




Competitive Compensation: We believe in recognizing the value and contributions of our employees by offering competitive salaries and compensation packages.
Comprehensive Health Coverage: We prioritize the health and welfare of our employees by providing comprehensive health insurance plans that cover medical, dental, and vision expenses.
Generous Leave Policies: We understand the importance of work-life balance and offer generous leave policies, including vacation days, personal days, and parental leave, to ensure our employees have time for rest, relaxation, and personal commitments.
Professional Development: We support the growth and advancement of our employees through various professional development programs, training opportunities, and educational assistance initiatives. We believe in investing in our employees' skills and knowledge.
Employee Assistance Programs: We care about the well-being of our employees and provide access to employee assistance programs that offer counseling, mental health support, and resources for personal and professional challenges.
Flexible Work Arrangements: We recognize the importance of flexibility and strive to offer flexible work arrangements, such as remote work options or flexible scheduling, to accommodate individual needs and promote work-life balance.
Recognition and Rewards: We value the hard work and achievements of our employees and have recognition and rewards programs in place to acknowledge their contributions and motivate continued excellence.
Inclusive and Diverse Environment: We foster an inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees feel valued, respected, and have equal opportunities for growth and advancement.
Social and Community Engagement: We encourage employees to participate in social and community engagement activities, such as volunteering initiatives, to give back to society and create a positive impact.





We welcome individuals of all nationalities with open arms. No matter where you're from, you have the opportunity to be a part of our awesome team. For further information regarding the job position and to gain a better understanding, we encourage you to visit our website.

Title: Data Analyst
text:
We’re looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our friendly team!




About Our Customer:




The customer provides products for mobile app solutions, effortless payment, paratransit, business travel, and advertising that reaches captive audiences of millions and traces its history of success back to 1992. They are creating a comprehensive mobility platform for operators to efficiently manage their vehicles and drivers, for regulators to be informed and establish guidelines, for service providers to deliver sustainable, future-proof solutions, and for riders to have an effortless transit experience.




About Our Project:




The project is a taxi ordering service. The user can hail a taxi and monitor its arrival, pay for a ride, and see their own trip history. The system contains the following components:




ride server (all data processing);
payment server (PCI DSS-compliant) which performs a transaction with the passenger's digital wallet and payment gateways;
mobile application (hail taxi, geocoding, map, payments);
taxi terminal (3rd party).




Project Team:




When you join our team, you'll be immersed in a culture where teammates always help each other achieve better results. We believe that together we are greater and that we can find brilliant solutions by sharing ideas.




Requirements:




Experience with tabular data (geospatial data is plus)
Ability to ask questions of data and use it to tell stories
Good communication skills
Attention to detail and desire to dive into business context
Strong fundamentals in statistics and Machine Learning
SQL and Python data toolbox: Pandas, GeoPandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Folium, sklearn, xgboost, etc. Familiarity with R is plus
Experience with Tableau and other BI tools is plus
Proven data cleansing and feature engineering experience
Ability to deliver the researched solution as part of data pipeline or as a service




Responsibilities:




Conduct data-driven analysis based on syndicated primary and secondary market research and customer data
Identify data requirements to be able to conduct future analytic studies in a timely and efficient manner given the needs that have arisen from previous studies
Participate in testing to ensure new marketing processes and applications deliver the business benefits as promised
Document and communicate marketing requirements for systems to IT
Coordinate operational readiness and product launch activities
Drive adoption of common marketing processes and languages




English level: Intermediate+




🌍 Location: Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bulgaria, Georgia, Hungary, Kazakhstan, Lithuania, Poland, Uzbekistan




💪 Why Join Us:




Customer's company fosters a collaborative and supportive culture where teammates uplift and inspire each other to achieve remarkable results. By joining the team, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with talented individuals who share a passion for innovation and creativity.




📩 Ready to Join?




To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter that highlights your relevant experience and why you are excited about this opportunity. We eagerly await your application and look forward to welcoming you to our team!

Title: Analista de Datos
text:
Job Description

Somos una de las aseguradoras más importantes del mundo, formada por personas positivas, dinámicas y comprometidas que hacen que las cosas ocurran. Creemos que nuestra diversidad aporta valor a los equipos, a nuestra cultura y a los clientes. Sabemos que las mejores ideas y soluciones surgen en entornos inclusivos donde todos nos sentimos vistos, escuchados y valorados para que podamos desarrollar nuestro máximo talento.

Qué te ofrecemos

Hemos sido reconocidos como uno de los mejores lugares para trabajar en España por la lista Forbes y el ranking de Actualidad Económica, y es que contamos con la mejor propuesta de valor para todos los que formamos parte de Aegon:

🤸‍♂️ Apostamos por la flexibilidad a través de nuestro modelo de trabajo híbrido: contamos con la posibilidad de teletrabajar al menos tres días por semana y también de compartir tiempo en unas oficinas adaptadas a la metodología ágil.
💃🏻 Te ayudamos a conciliar y desconectar, con flexibilidad horaria durante todo el año y jornada intensiva en el verano.
🥰 Las mejores acciones para tu bienestar físico y mental (seguro de salud gratuito, fisioterapia en la oficina, iniciativas de vida saludable, etc.) y un gran abanico de beneficios y ventajas sociales (la empresa hace una alta aportación a tu plan de pensiones, seguro de ahorro para la jubilación, retribución flexible, ayudas a la formación, regalo de Navidad, etc.).
🏔️ Oportunidades de desarrollo a todos los niveles mediante proyectos transversales e internacionales. Contamos con acciones de reconocimiento, compensación variable para todos y feedback continuo. Nuestro modelo de gestión está basado en tener conversaciones de calidad de manera recurrente, donde tendrás un papel protagonista.
💙 Cultura: el 87% de empleados estamos orgullosos de trabajar en Aegon. Somos una empresa internacional, cercana y empática.


La oportunidad laboral de tu vida

¿Te gustaría ayudar a las personas a vivir su mejor vida?, es a lo que nos dedicamos en nuestro día a día. Lo logramos gracias a que somos una empresa de personas que cuidan de personas, con curiosidad, conectados con la realidad que nos rodea y centrados en dejar un mundo mejor de como lo hemos encontrado. Siempre aprendemos de nuestros clientes y de las demás personas. ¡Esperamos que te apasione tanto como a nosotros!

Sobre la posición :

Si tienes un perfil de Analista Datos acostumbrado a trabajar con las áreas de negocio donde debes manejar, extraer y controlar gran cantidad de información para apoyar a los diferentes departamentos de la dirección financiera, esto te interesa. Buscamos un profesional que le apasione todo lo relacionado con el dato, de forma que su mayor valor añadido se centre en la generación y tratamiento de información, pero sin perder de vista la integridad y el cuadre de información.

Trabajarás en el soporte al departamento Actuarial en el tratamiento y generación de datos.
Realizarás análisis de datos para evaluar la calidad e integridad de los datos reportados a las diferentes áreas.
Automatizarás y documentarás diferentes procesos de la dirección financiera.
Desarrollarás el mantenimiento, mejora y enriquecimiento de la información requerida en los reportes trimestrales.
Trabajarás el cuadre de información Técnica-financiera.
Analizarás y estudiarás ad-hoc la información contenida en el Data Warehouse corporativo.
Colaborarás y liderarás en los diferentes proyectos de la dirección financiera (IFRS17, DWH, etc)


Sobre tus habilidades:

Grado/Licenciatura en Estadística, Matemáticas o Informática
Conocimientos de SAS, SQL
Conocimiento avanzado en Excel, VBA.
Valorable conocimiento Python
Valorable nivel Alto de Inglés.
Experiencia al menos 1 año en análisis y tratamiento de datos.
Capacidad de orientación al detalle, analista, innovador y con capacidad de trabajo transversal con otros departamentos

Title: Data Engineer up to 6000 BGN net Remote
text:
Data Engineer function will be focused on the collecting, storing, processing and preparing datasets for analyzing world class products – features adoption, client’s acquisition and behavior, customers lifetime value etc. And on the other side, be part of the team developing analytics as a product, which is reaching one of the biggest operators in the industry.

You will oversee the ingestion, transformation, delivery, and movement of data throughout every part of an organization. The primary focus will be on choosing optimal solutions to use for these purposes, then maintaining, implementing, and monitoring them. You will also be responsible for integrating them with the architecture used across the company.

With whom you will work?

The day-to-day interactions are mainly with the product and analytics/ BI team members, working on improvement and expansion of our data models.
In maintaining and optimizing our data infrastructure will be in touch with the DevOps and DBA teams.
When have to include new data in the data models and/or reflect the latest platform changes, you will be working with the dev engineering teams.

Tools you will use on a daily bases

Databases - PostgreSQL and Oracle
Programming languages – SQL / Python / Scala / Java
Computing frameworks - Apache Spark / Kafka / Hadoop and Hadoop YARN

Responsibilities

You will develop and maintain the different data pipelines in order to ensure the quality and accuracy of our product analytics, as well as build datasets for reports and visualizations for internal use and external customers.
Explore and implement data and technology best practices, guidelines, and repeatable processes in building pipelines, logical data models and pre-aggregated analytics data sets
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of large volumes of data from a wide variety of data sources - both internal and external
Proactively identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Develop ETL monitoring and testing in order to troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues, ensuring data quality and availability
You will provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior members of the data engineering team.

About You

At least 3 years of experience in Dev engineering role
Experience with feature engineering and data pipelines using Python, SQL, Scala and similar programming language
Strong knowledge of distributed computing frameworks, likeApache Spark, Hadoop and Hadoop YARN, for managing and processing big data sets
Experience in data acquisition (API calls/FTP downloads), ETL, transformation / normalization (from raw to DB table schema structure), storage (Raw files, Database server), distribution & access (Entitlements for users, build of API’s and access points for data)
Solid knowledge of data warehousing platforms like Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, Oracle, including data transformation (DBT, Talend), data model design and query optimization strategies
Experience in data management – clean and commented code, version control, documentation, automated testing and deployment etc.
Familiar with the design (dimensional modeling and schema design) and optimization of databases or data warehouses - including handling and logging errors, system monitoring
Experience with event-driven technologies and streaming such as RMQ and/or Kafka

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
text:
At commercetools, we are:




Engaged: We didn't become the fastest growing, highest ever valued SaaS software company in digital commerce with nearly 100% year-over-year growth by sitting on the sidelines.




Inspired: We continually explore what's possible. As the founder of the headless commerce concept, the leader in true composable commerce, and the visionaries behind MACH® — our patented tech has radically disrupted the world of enterprise ecommerce software. And we are just getting started!




Valued: Intelligent, resilient, passionate individuals hailing from over 50 countries across the globe, speaking over 43 languages, and collectively embracing diversity, encouraging inclusion, and fostering a culture of care.




The Opportunity:




commercetools encourages critical thinking and data-driven decision-making. To support our data strategy, we are hiring an experienced Data Analyst who really enjoys building things from scratch! Essentially, you will act as a catalyst for change in how commercetools stores, processes and utilizes data. Our ultimate goal is to create new dashboards and reports using Tableau to provide a user-friendly and intuitive experience to our internal users.




Please note that for this role, we can currently hire candidates based in the following countries: Austria, France, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Spain, and the United Kingdom.




Your Mission:




Designing and implementing our BI solution (Tableau) and ensuring that all data protection requirements are met
Supporting Data Engineers on planning and developing new data models that allow user-friendly, customized reporting
Supporting the various international business units by giving them access to BI solutions tailored for their needs
Creating customized dashboards based on those data models
Driving the right strategy to continuously increase dashboard performance




What you need to succeed:




Around 3-5 years professional experience in the field of Business Intelligence on the Analysis and Administration side
A proven track record of successfully implementing and administrating BI reports using Tableau
Experience in managing complex BI projects
Sound knowledge of query and data manipulation languages e.g. SQL, etc.
Good understanding of data structures and data management
Strong analytical thinking skills
A naturally proactive approach with the ability to bring new ideas to fruition in a solution-oriented way
Fluency in English




Nice to have:




Knowledge on Google Cloud Platform solutions, basic Python




We Care About Your Growth And Well-being




☀️ Remote Work: Up to 60 days/year from a country different from your base country




💻 Open Learning & Development Budget




📚 ct Academy: Regular internal training sessions




🙌 Our Benefits: Check them out here




⌚️ Flexibility: Morning person or night owl? We believe in outcome and motivated employees




🚀 Mindset & Growth: A diverse workspace with an open, international culture & learning environment




Are you ready? Come grow with us!




🔍 Are you looking for something else? Check out our Career Page and our Website for more information.




We are all different and that is what makes us stronger! We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company better.




commercetools celebrates being a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. If your professional profile aligns with our specific hiring requirements and company culture, then we encourage you to apply. We will assess your competencies, future potential, approach to learning and self-development and passion, and not your age, color, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, familial status, genetics, or disability.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (m/w/d)
text:
Turbit develops and researches AI services for renewable energy assets. It has established itself as a market leader in AI-based operational management of wind turbines in Europe.




Tasks

Interested? Get in touch. Send us your application letter with a full CV and references/grades. We are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Engineer in der Unternehmensberatung
text:

Unsere selbstentwickelte Analyseplattform premergency bietet folgende Funktionen:




Verschiedene Backend Services

gute Erfahrung in Softwarearchitektur - Du solltest relevante Autoren und Gestaltungsmuster kennen,

überdurchschnittliche Vergütung
natürlich Hardware fürs Home Office
Förderung von Women in Tech und Women Techmakers,
kostenlose, warme und kalte Getränke,
Obstkorb & Snacks für den Vitaminhaushalt,

Jobticket oder Tiefgaragenstellplatz auf Wunsch,

vermögenswirksame Leistungen des Arbeitgebers.




Arbeitsatmosphäre




spannende Kunden und Projekte
flexible Arbeitszeiten und -konten
eigene Produktentwicklung aus Big Data und Algorithmik
lockere Arbeitsatmosphäre in einem jungen, innovativen aber sehr erfahrenen Team

300m von der Stadtbahnhaltestelle Hürth-Efferen entfernt, Bushaltestelle direkt vor der Tür; 20min zum Flughafen, 20min zum ICE-Bahnhof

neuester Laptop, 27″ Displays

sonnendurchflutete Büros (im Sommer Klimatisierung und Verschattung)

Wir freuen uns Dich kennenzulernen!

Title: Data Engineer_Automobilbranche (w/m/d) - bundesweit remote

Cloud Data Engineer (All genders)

Es unterstützt Kunden aus verschiedenen Branchen bei der Digitalen Transformation, vor allem in Themenfeldern wie AI& Data Analytics, Cloud & Migration, IoT und Software Development. Du entwickelst dich stets technisch und professionell weiter und fördert das Wissen im Team

30 Tage Urlaubstage

Große langfristige Projekte im Enterprise-Umfeld, vor allem mit Fokus auf Automobilbranche
Teamarbeit bei Kundenprojekten statt Ein-Mann-Armee
Agile Projektarbeit nach Scrum-Ansatz
Unterschiedliche Möglichkeiten, deine Karriere mitzugestalten

Title: Data Analyst
text:
We are looking for a Data Analyst that has the mindset of an analytics evangelist, that believes and promotes the potential of data and analytics as an enabler, facilitator and true accelerator for effectiveness in any product role.




Someone who delivers outstanding quality analytical products, searches for the most context to answer the true business needs and mentors on the why and how to use analytics.




Someone who understand the challenges of data and analytics but is willing to overcome them with a resilient, growth mindset, that trusts the team and is trustworthy, that seeks to exceed expectations and has extreme ownership.




Key Responsibilities




As a RD Data Analytics Practice team member you will have the team’s mission to make “Every product decision and strategy to be Analytics-driven first!“. You will work together with four exceptional Data Analytics enablers, who are fully committed with defining, implementing and adopting, data and analytics best practices that ensure that all team members deliver excellent, high quality and effective analytical products.




As a Data Analyst your objective is to enable a R&D group to be highly engaged with analytics that drives decisions and strategy definition towards the team’s goals. You will work in a full embedded mode within that group, to get as much business context as possible and understand how data and analytics can accelerate the group's journey towards success.




The Vision Is To Make Data And Analytics a Generic Capability, Enabler And a Driver For Business Opportunities Through The Deliver And/or Enablement Of




Your principal stakeholders are product and R&D teams that you will enable on using analytics consistently and frequently to define their strategy, monitor their success and learn product behavioral patterns that can lead to new opportunities.




Strategic Reports and Dashboards to track and communicate with rigor, the group’s results and success against their goals and strategy.
Tactical Team’s Performance Dashboards to monitor the team’s performance against the critical success factors of a R&D Team Excellence maturity model.
Product Measurement Frameworks to track the utilization, quality and business impact of the group’s products.
Product analytics to learn behavioral insights and user’s profile.




Your Core Responsibilities Will Be




Design, develop and maintain data models based on business / product analytics requirements, applying best practices to ensure high data quality and governance.
Design, develop, validate and maintain impactful reports, dashboards and monitoring systems that tell the story behind the data, helping product and R&D teams reach the right conclusions and make the right decisions to impact their goals.
Troubleshoot and manage data incidents, analyze data issues and problems within reports, monitor data sources changes and updates, contributing to the design and implementation of data gov solutions that increase our data quality.
Fully understand the customer/user journey through in-depth data analysis.
Communicate complex analytical results to internal and external stakeholders, in a clear and appropriate manner.
Collaborate, enable and guide Product and R&D teams to shape the data we collect and how we can tailor our products to fuel the build-measure-learn cycle.
Interact and collaborate cross-functionally with different teams, to identify opportunities and improve our products and data platform.
Provide technical expertise and best practices in data modeling / storage structures, ETL and data cleansing, to the more junior members of the team.
Keep up with the state-of-the-art in terms of data governance best practices, BI analytics tools, and contribute/ enable that knowledge towards improving R&D data practice.




The successful candidate will demonstrate high proactivity and accountability to solve data problems and increase analytics effectiveness, flexibility and adaptability to handle multiple and changing priorities and be able to successfully collaborate with development teams, technology groups, and key business stakeholders.




Preferred Qualifications




MSc with solid mathematics and statistics components (e.g. Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics).
3+ years of professional experience as a data/ BI analyst with excellent expertise in designing and developing high quality report and dashboard, using industry standard business intelligence stacks.
Excellent professional experience in analytics requirements gathering, ETL and dimensional modeling techniques.
Excellent professional experience with PowerBI, SSAS and DBT is highly valued.
Excellent professional experience with SQL.
Good professional experience presenting and communicating outputs and outcomes derived from data analysis activities, to different audiences, using excellent data visualizations that convey clear and powerful insights.
Professional experience with data analysis / science tools such as R, Scipy, Matplotlib or Pandas is a plus.
Good grasp of measures/ indicators design fundamentals.
Good grasp of Statistics fundamentals.
Good understanding of the product management standards and product analytics, metrics and benchmark analysis (e.g. funnel analysis, A/B Testing) is valued.
Fluent in english, written and spoken.
Be creative, ambitious and curious. Be resourceful and innovative.




The Longer Story




One of the fastest-growing B2B software companies in the world, OutSystems is on a mission to enable every organization to innovate through software. We are looking for talented and motivated people to join us in helping companies solve some of their most strategic business challenges, from modernizing their workplace processes to transforming their employee and customer experiences. As a member of the OutSystems global team, you will help build, deliver, manage, and evolve the software that is a low-code market leader and preferred by professional developers around the world.




OutSystems is a truly global company, with more than 525,000 developer community members, 1,700 employees, 400 partners, and thousands of active customers in over 87 countries and across 22 industries. Founded in 2001, OutSystems has offices in the United States, United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Germany, the UAE, Japan, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Australia, and Singapore, and of course has a thriving, worldwide community of remote employees.




Working at OutSystems




We do not have many rules, but we do have high standards and a culture of global collaboration. Our commitment to our culture is highlighted in The Small Book of the Few Big Rules, written by our Founder and CEO, Paulo Rosado. This commitment to culture landed us in the Forbes top cloud computing employers four years in a row.




We grow, change, and innovate, and give our teams the space to be proactive and creative.
We care about growth and development. Vertical career progression is obvious, and we also encourage lateral moves, joining different teams, and mastering new skills.
Global colleagues who are as smart, hardworking, and driven as you.
Our DNA is disrupting the status quo. It is why our company exists.
We “Ask Why” a lot. It helps us connect our individual work to the bigger picture and often uncovers a better, more agile way.




What do we have to offer you?




A company that continues to grow, change and innovate, and gives our teams the space to be proactive and creative.
Real career opportunities. We care about growth and development. Vertical career progression is an obvious possibility, but we also offer the possibility for lateral moves, joining different teams, and mastering specific skills.
Work colleagues that are as smart, hardworking and driven as you – and a team that is global.
A company culture that is based on transparency, teamwork and excellence (as promised in our Small Book of the Few Big Rules and delivered every day.)
Disrupting the status quo is in our DNA. In fact, it’s why our company exists.
We “Ask Why” a lot. It helps us connect our individual work to the bigger picture and sometimes even uncover a better way.




Are you ready for the next step in your career? Then we’d love to hear from you!




OutSystems nurtures an inclusive culture of diversity, where everyone feels empowered to be their authentic self and perform at their best. A company that embraces the creativity and innovation that comes through diverse perspectives. We are committed to creating a team that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants receive equal consideration regardless of race, place of origin, color, age, marital status, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, protected veteran status, disability status or any other status protected by law.

Title: Software Engineer
text:
Chi siamo:




Siamo un team di sviluppatori creatori di Nosco, una piattaforma per facilitare l'adozione dell'Agile e dell'IoT nel Customer Service. 

Leanbit ha una struttura orizzontale permeata di cultura Agile. 

Ah siamo anche partner AWS.




Cosa farai:




Conoscerai persone interessanti, colleghi e clienti, con cui troverai soluzioni a problemi concreti che rallentano le performance aziendali e preoccupano le persone che costituiscono l'essenza delle aziende.

Lo farai applicando principi Agile, sviluppando codice prevalentemente in Ruby, Javascript e Go e utilizzando architetture basate su AWS e Google Cloud.

Avrai modo di crescere verticalmente sulle tue hard skill con un programma formativo fatto di certificazioni ufficiali e giornate dedicate alle studio. Potrai anche cimentarti con le tue soft skill tramite mentoring e coaching a cui partecipiamo tutti.




Requisiti:




- Background scolastico scientifico

- Comprensione del mindset Agile e Lean

- Passione per lo sviluppo di software

- Mother tongue Italian; proficient in English

- Una laurea è un plus (il voto non ci interessa). Se non ne hai una facci sapere dove hai investito il tuo tempo magari ha ancora più valore.

- Esperienza di sviluppo software in un team Agile è un plus

- Certificazioni o esperienza nell'uso di AWS o Google cloud sono un plus

- Conoscenza di SQL è un plus

- Conoscenza di Ruby, Javascript o Go è un plus

- Nozioni di statistica, ETL, data engineering o data visualization sono un plus

- Essere uno specialista Frontend, Backend, DevOps è un plus ma se sei un tanto bistrattato Fullstack non ti preoccupare l'hype non fa per noi




Perché Candidarsi:




Crediamo che investire nelle persone sia la chiave di qualsiasi attività umana. Crediamo nella diversità e nella inclusione. Puoi lavorare da remoto o in ufficio, ci piace stare assieme ma sappiamo che l'equilibrio personale è importante quando lo sono i risultati che si ottengono e che sono anche strettamente correlati.

is responsible for delivering analytics for Business Transformation and Data Governance project. Working with multiple systems origin, Analyst will be a member of team responsible for org. standardization investigations and knowledge.

Title: Senior Software Engineer - ML (f/m/d)
text:
Factory software is at the core of value creation, it is crucial to our society because it helps manufacturing companies become more productive, efficient, and environmentally friendly at producing all we need for our daily lives. Due to the complex and heterogeneous nature of factories, building factory software is exceedingly difficult. HappyOps is solving this problem. We strive to build and run powerful data-driven applications that help factories answer questions, reduce waste, and increase performance. In order to do that we build software modules using a variety of cutting edge technologies. Our applications run in multiple factories across Europe and across different industries.




Tasks




We are looking for an experienced software engineer with an academic background and/or professional experience in data science / AI to join our team. You will be responsible for creating value out of data sets we capture from our customer’s factories by harnessing the power of AI.




You will add your own talents and experience to the team: together we will push the envelope and move the boundary of what is considered possible in the space of advanced software systems on the factory shop-floor.




Your responsibilities:




Set up a tech stack / architecture to run ML workloads
Conceptualize and develop first AI use case hypotheses in close collaboration with our customers / domain experts
Validate these hypotheses by implementing, testing and running applications in production
Conduct research on whether GenAI and LLMs can be used to create value in manufacturing processes




Requirements




We seek an outstanding candidate, who is highly driven, smart, confident, and gritty. Our perfect match is hungry to learn and enjoys working in fast-paced environments.




You have at least 5+ years of experience working in software development, ideally on full-stack applications, but in the last few years you have been gaining experience in the field of AI and ML
You have experience building and deploying scalable machine learning solutions and data-driven systems
You are familiar with Typescript, Node.js and PosGresSQL
You are a pragmatic engineer. You love challenges and you have a roll-up-your-sleeves and get-stuff-done attitude
You have a strong curiosity and forward-thinking mindset in the field of AI, with an interest in exploring AI technologies into product development.
You have excellent analytical skills, you are diligent, have great attention to detail, and you are able to consistently deliver results under pressure
You value close collaboration with the founder, to shape the product together
You are fluent in English, German is a plus




Benefits




A unique opportunity to revolutionize the manufacturing industry, displace old-school software, and have a tangible impact on the HappyOps success story




A highly relevant technical challenge paired with stimulating use cases from the tangible real world
A world-class multicultural team: we don’t just work together, we truly care about each other and seek to bring out the best in each other every day
If you need more private time to take care of your loved ones then we will try our best to accommodate their needs
A flexible and high-paced work environment, with low hierarchies, competitive compensation, and equity package
We are a remote-first team, so you will have the chance to work from anywhere in Germany, with flexible working hours.




Compensation Range: the compensation range for this role as a base salary is 80,000€ - 110,000€ annually.




Does this sound like you? Then we would love to hear from you! We encourage everyone to apply! In case this role sounds interesting but you don’t think you meet all the qualifications, we will still be happy to hear from you! We are interested to hear about the value you can bring to the role and to HappyOps.




Last but not least, when judging your fit for this position we will not consider your age, gender, sexual identity and/or expression, ethnicity, or religion as these are not relevant to your role within the team.

Title: Data Center Engineer (Full-remote) - IT
Junior System Engineer - Linux (m/w/d)
text:
dynexo, ein Unternehmen der DISION Technologies Group, ist spezialisiert auf IT- und Cyber-Security-Lösungen.




Mit einem erfahrenen Team aus Experten bieten wir unseren Kunden individuelle Beratung und maßgeschneiderte Lösungen, um ihre IT-Infrastruktur sicher und geschützt zu halten.




Von der Netzwerksicherheit bis hin zur Cloud-Sicherheit bieten wir ein breites Spektrum an Dienstleistungen, Rund um Security, Informationssicherheit und Datenschutz.




Gemeinsam mit unseren Entwicklungsteams stellen wir sicher, dass Anwendungen, Dienste und Systeme sicher sind und den neuesten Industriestandards entsprechen.




Aufgaben




Wir suchen einen motivierten Junior System Engineer, der sich auf Linux Betriebssysteme und Digitalisierung spezialisiert hat und unser Team bei dynexo unterstützen möchte!




Als System Engineer bei dynexo wirst du verantwortlich sein für die Implementierung und Wartung von Anwendungen, Systemen und Servern, On-Premises und in der Cloud.




Du wirst auch eng mit unseren Entwicklern zusammenarbeiten, Playbooks und Routinen entwicklen, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere Anwendungen sicher sind und den neuesten Industriestandards entsprechen.




Um erfolgreich in dieser Rolle zu sein, solltest du ein Verständnis für Linux Systeme, idealerweise auf Basis von RedHat, Ubuntu und Debian haben, sowie Erfahrung in der Implementierung von Lösungen in Cloud-Umgebungen.




Du solltest auch Erfahrung in der Verwendung von Automatisierungswerkzeugen haben, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere Systeme und Anwendungen verfügbar und ständig geschützt sind.




Zu deinen Aufgaben gehören:




Aufbau und Konfiguration von IT-Systemen, On-Premises und in der Cloud
Entwicklung und Weiterentwicklung von IT-Systemen
Mitwirken an Projekten mit IT-Schwerpunkt
Unterstützung bei der Umsetzung von IT-Lösungen
Fehleranalyse und Troubleshooting




Qualifikation




Studium in der Informatik, Ausbildung oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Kenntnisse und Erfahrung im Umgang mit IT-Systemen
Kenntnisse zu Microsoft Betriebssystemen und Linux
sichere Deutschkenntnisse, in Wort und Schrift (C1-Level)
Englischkenntnisse, in Wort und Schrift




Benefits




Ein junges, dynamisches, internationales Team, das offen für neue Ideen und Innovationen ist
Eine entspannte Arbeitsumgebung mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Ein familien- und kinderfreundliches Arbeitsumfeld
Ein attraktives Gehaltspaket mit Bonusmöglichkeiten
Ein umfangreiches Benefits-Paket inkl. Dienstrad und betrieblicher Altersvorsorge
Kontinuierliche Schulungen und Fortbildungen
Regelmäßige Firmen-Veranstaltungen und Team-Events




Worauf wartest du noch?




Du hast Leidenschaft für Informatik, Mathematik, Programmierung oder Online-Zocken und hast Lust in einem aufregenden Umfeld zu arbeiten, dann bewirb dich bei uns!




Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennenzulernen.

Title: Software Engineer
text:

L'Azienda

ZonWizard SRL è una startup innovativa incubata presso CesenaLab (FC), che sviluppa strumenti software in cloud rivolti ad aziende che operano nel settore dell’e-commerce con un focus particolare su Amazon.

sviluppo di nuove funzionalità back-end (Django) e front-end
sviluppo app mobile
integrazioni API con altri servizi
ottimizzazione performance database SQL

Potrai prendere parte attivamente all’intero Software Development Lifecycle.




Che Ambiente Troverai

Entrando in ZonWizard potrai far parte di una startup in fase di scale-up, che ha già all'attivo un prodotto e migliaia di clienti. Troverai un team giovane e un clima informale. Potrai ricavarti uno spazio di rilievo all'interno del team, confrontandoti direttamente con i founder.




Cosa Offriamo

Offriamo un contratto di collaborazione di 6 mesi, propedeutico alla stabilizzazione con contratto a tempo indeterminato. Le attività verranno svolte principalmente da remoto, ma sono previsti incontri in presenza presso CesenaLab.

Database relazionali

Precisione e attenzione ai dettagli




Requisiti Preferibili

Conoscenza di Bootstrap

Title: Cloud System Engineer
text:
Da 13 anni, Imagicle progetta e sviluppa una suite di applicazioni di UC e soluzioni conversazionali omnicanale, basate sull’Intelligenza Artificiale, al fine di migliorare la Customer (CX) e la Employee (EX) Experience, nel Cloud o nei Data Center dei nostri clienti, per il massimo della flessibilità.

Abbiamo iniziato in Italia insieme ai nostri partner e oggi siamo presenti in quasi tutto il mondo anche grazie alle nostre sedi estere (Ryad, Dubai, Miami e Parigi). Le nostre applicazioni, utilizzate in oltre 150 Paesi nel mondo, soprattutto in Europa, Medio Oriente e Nord America, aiutano i clienti ad avere comunicazioni più veloci, intelligenti e semplici raggiungendo più di 20.000 clienti nella nostra storia.

In Imagicle, lavoriamo instancabilmente per migliorare le nostre soluzioni, arricchendole e potenziandole, in modo da renderle intuitive, semplici e allineate alle esigenze dei nostri clienti. La nostra principale missione è garantire la felicità dei clienti, sempre e prima di tutto.

Sei un appassionato di tecnologia cloud? Nel nostro team di operations, avrai l'opportunità di progettare e sviluppare applicazioni all'avanguardia utilizzando metodologie SCRUM-Agile e Test Driven Development. Parteciperai alla costruzione un stack VoIP personalizzato, integrando le nostre soluzioni con le principali piattaforme UC, sia on-premises che nel cloud.

Imagicle è dentro la sfida tecnologica del cloud già da anni e stiamo andando a grande velocità. Siamo alla ricerca di persone motivate e talentuose come te per unirti al nostro team internazionale fatto di persone di valore e competenti. Crediamo fermamente nell'importanza delle persone e investiamo nel loro percorso e contributo al nostro progetto.

Come Cloud System Engineer, avrai un ruolo cruciale nella gestione delle nostre infrastrutture nei public Cloud Provider e nella cura dei sistemi IT aziendali. Sarai una persona che lascerà un impatto, affrontando le sfide con determinazione e organizzando autonomamente il tuo lavoro.

Cosa farai in Imagicle

Gestirai in modo efficace le nostre infrastrutture interne, nonché quelle su cloud pubblici e ibridi
Sarai incaricato della gestione delle operation usando strumenti di automazione e migliorando costantemente i processi
Ti occuperai della manutenzione e sviluppo delle principali infrastrutture (VPN, DNS, routing protocols, etc.)
Contribuirai attivamente a garantire gli alti standard di sicurezza che abbiamo
Sarai un catalizzatore di idee nuove e originali per risolvere esigenze e problemi legati al Cloud

Cosa devi avere/conoscere

Laurea magistrale in Informatica/Ingegneria informatica o culture equivalenti
Buona conoscenza di Python
Esperienza con uno o più fornitori di cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure, ecc.)
Solida conoscenza delle reti e dei loro standard (routing, BGP)
Esperienza con sistemi di containerizzazione (Docker, Garden, etc.)
Familiarità con la metodologia SCRUM Agile e i principi DevOPS
Eccellente conoscenza della lingua inglese (livello minimo B2)
Capacità di lavorare in modo efficace sia all'interno di un team sia in autonomia
Propensione al lavoro di gruppo e capacità di collaborazione
Desiderio costante di apprendimento e di sfidare se stessi

Ed è meglio se

Conosci strumenti di Infrastructure Automation systems (Ansible, Terraform, etc.)
Possiedi una buona conoscenza delle tematiche di sicurezza delle applicazioni e infrastrutture
Hai familiarità con microservices e serverless architecture
Hai abilità di organizzazione e razionalizzazione del lavoro per massimizzare l'efficienza

Cosa troverai

Un team affiatato di colleghi internazionali competenti e sempre pronti a dare una mano
Un ambiente di lavoro accogliente e dinamico, che tu stesso potrai contribuire a migliorare
La possibilità di lavorare da casa quando vorrai ma anche la disponibilità di lavorare presso i nostri uffici in Italia e all’estero
Strumenti di lavoro innovativi basati sul Cloud che ci permettono di lavorare ovunque
Miglioramento delle competenze con le ultime tecnologie UCC e IT
Impegno a lungo termine e un percorso di crescita professionale personalizzato definito in base alle tue caratteristiche
L'accesso totalmente a carico dell'azienda a una piattaforma di e-learning con all'interno più di 4000 corsi su vendita, soft-skills e IT
Buoni pasto del valore di 8,00 euro per ogni giorno lavorato
Un piano di compensi e incentivi in grado di premiare la tua voglia di raggiungere e superare gli obiettivi
Una cultura aziendale incentrata sul miglioramento continuo delle metodologie di lavoro
Un ambiente informale, dove si vive in armonia e dove contiamo su di te per renderlo migliore, perché “E’ sempre una questione di persone felici”

Unisciti a Imagicle per un'esperienza professionale appagante, in cui la tua passione per il cloud troverà terreno fertile e la tua crescita sarà costantemente supportata. Inviaci subito la tua candidatura e diventa parte della nostra squadra che abbraccia il futuro della tecnologia cloud, da qualsiasi nostro ufficio (Massarosa, Treviso o Magenta) o comodamente da casa tua.

Sei pronto per la sfida? E’ un momento magico per lavorare in Imagicle!

Title: Analista programador/a Java - Datos ETL
text:
En Getronics queremos ampliar nuestro equipo y queremos incorporar a un/a Analista Java para que nos ayude a gestionar un proyecto de una entidad pública clave en modalidad de teletrabajo, con horario de oficina flexible y jornada intensiva los viernes y meses de verano.




La persona que se incorpore nos ayudará a participando en los desarrollos necesarios de una aplicación programada en Java (componente Conneon) formando parte del proyecto de servicios de desarrollo de aplicaciones sectoriales de soporte a las obligaciones establecidas por la Ley y su integración en los sistemas de este organismo público.




REQUISITOS




Imprescindible tener 5 años de experiencia y/o conocimientos avanzados en equipos de desarrollo Java con las siguientes tecnologías:

Java, Javascript, HTML5, Angular,Vue.jsSpring Boot
Spring Security
MyBatis
IntelliJ, Maven, Nexus
GIT como control de versiones
Servidor de Aplicaciones: WildFly 10.2, 11
Servidor web: Nginx 1.7.12
Gestión de tickets: Jira, Mantis, etc..




Se valorará positivamente aunque no es imprescindible tener conocimientos y/o experiencia en en proyectos de desarrollo relacionados con datos ETL/BBDD,




¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS?




Podrás crearte tu propio plan de formación, seleccionando tus propios contenidos entre una plataforma propia con más de 15.000 opciones a tu alcance, entre las que encontrarás contenidos acerca de las últimas tecnologías, metodologías ágiles, finanzas personales o salud mental, entre muchas otras opciones.
Estabilidad, ya que formarás parte de una empresa con 130 años de historia y 4.000 empleados en 23 países, de los cuales, 1.800 están en España.
Crecimiento profesional. Tendrás acceso a todas las vacantes de Getronics por si quieres dar un salto en tu carrera. Además, ponemos a tu disposición GetLead, un programa destinado a acompañar en el camino a nuestros futuros líderes.
Formarás parte de un gran equipo con el que crecer día a día.
Podrás acogerte a retribución flexible para que puedas beneficiarte de aquello que más se ajuste a tus necesidades: ticket restaurante, guardería, transporte, seguro privado…
Disfrutarás de flexibilidad horaria para que puedas compatibilizar tu vida profesional y personal.
Trabajo en modalidad remota.




Si ves que la posición encaja con tu perfil y cumples con los requisitos indicados, ¡INSCRÍBETE AHORA!

Title: Data Entry Analyst
text:
| Why C-MORE? |




C-MORE is a technology company, specializing in Software as a Service for sustainability management (ESG). We are committed to the idea that the success and future of companies depend on the successful integration of sustainability data, indicators, and initiatives (ESG) in their business models. To achieve this, we develop market-leading sustainability management software as plug-and-play SaaS for SMEs, financial institutions, and enterprises. We believe in fostering a culture of Collaboration to help our clients transition to this new approach, with each team member playing an integral part in our Mission-Driven ethos.




At C-MORE, we don’t want to only accept differences. We want to celebrate the difference and see beyond the obvious. C-More is proud to be an equal opportunity company, that does not discriminate against race, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, disability, or gender identity.




We Embrace a Culture of Collaboration, Mission-Driven, Openness, Responsibility, and Excellence




| Who and why are we hiring? |




C-MORE is looking for a meticulous, diligent, and detail-oriented individual to fill the position of a Data Entry Analyst. The ideal candidate should be proficient in data analysis, data management, and able to work accurately to meet deadlines. Knowledge of Excel functions, sustainable KPIs, and experience in the handling of business and sustainability reports is highly beneficial.




CORE TASKS ARE EXPECTED TO INCLUDE:




Perform data entry duties by gathering, compiling, and sorting information from various resources including sustainability reports, in alignment with our culture of Collaboration and Excellence.




Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets, demonstrating a Mission Driven approach to deliver meaningful results.




Verify accuracy and sort information according to priorities to prepare data for analysis, showing a strong sense of Responsibility.




Utilize Excel functions for data processing and analysis, maintaining an Openness to learn and apply new techniques.




Foster a collaborative environment by effectively communicating with team members and stakeholders.




REQUIREMENTS AND SKILLS:




Proven working experience in data entry or a related field.




Proficiency in using Microsoft Excel for data entry, data management, and calculations.




Attention to detail with an ability to spot numerical errors.




Good understanding of sustainability KPIs.




Ability to interpret and analyze complex data.




Excellent time management skills and the ability to meet deadlines.




Fluent English language.




Relevant education for the function.




Fast typing with an incredible eye for detail.




Creative and problem solver.




Resilient.




Autonomous and capable of multitasking, planning, and prioritizing.




Strong alignment with our C-MORE culture and values.




APPLICATION TEST:




In order to proceed with the application, we invite you to complete the next step of the process.




This next step consists of a data entry test.




The goal of this test is: to complete the requested information for some companies, according to several Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that you will find in each sustainability report of the correspondent company.




Before you start this process, please, take the time to read the instructions on this e-mail, carefully, so you don’t miss any cues that might help you with the test.




First step: Please open the link below and download all the files:




Second step: Analyze the folder in which you will find an Excel workbook with 2 tabs:




An index, which will contain the description of the Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) you will be required to fill out. You will also find other information that will be useful during your test, such as expected measures of the KPIs (e.g., Millions $), sections of the reports in which you might find the requested info, and keywords to help you in your search.




An Excel spreadsheet that you should complete with the requested information:




In line 3, you will find an example of a company that already has the requested information, in the way that it should be reported.




In lines 5, 6, and 7 you can find the 3 listed companies for which you need to find and insert data.




The columns present the KPIs and respective units in which the information should be entered.




Third step: Verify that you have a total of 4 reports, one for each company listed on the Excel file.




Fourth Step: We suggest you read the index first, and then try to find the already completed information of the company in line 2. If you are able to find all the available information of this company, please proceed to the next step.




Fifth step: Complete the missing information of the companies in lines 5, 6 and 7.




Some important guidelines and instructions to complete this task that you should keep in mind:




Only one value should be reported in each cell (no intervals).




Do not use text to report, unless in KPIs that require it (e.g., Country of the company).




Only use a comma separator for decimal values (you should not use separators for hundreds, millions, etc.).




All values must be reported with 2 decimal cases (if applicable).




No symbols should be used, i.e. if the value to report is 8,94%, only insert 8,94.




If you can’t find information for one of the KPIs, please leave the cell blank.




In some cases, you may need to convert values to the requested units. In these cases, refer to the previous index for clarification on which measure to use and convert accordingly (e.g., Thousands $ to Millions $).




You may need to use excel formulas to calculate some KPIs. In these cases, refer to the previous index for clarification on which calculations you might need to conduct.




We remind you that the goal of this test is to find the right requested KPI information on the reports provided and enter it in the data entry file, for each company.




Please reply to this application attaching the completed Excel file that you received with the following file name format: Data Entry_test_[YOUR NAME]




You’ll receive prompt feedback after we carry out our internal analysis.




At C-MORE, we recognize that our strength and success lie in the collective abilities and diversity of our team. We are committed to creating an environment where everyone can bring their full selves to work, grow professionally, and make a meaningful impact. If you believe you can contribute to our mission and embody our values, we encourage you to apply.




We thank all applicants for their interest in C-MORE, however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.




Come join us and let’s build a great company culture together!

Title: Data Entry Analyst
text:
| Why C-MORE? |




C-MORE is a technology company, specializing in Software as a Service for sustainability management (ESG). We are committed to the idea that the success and future of companies depend on the successful integration of sustainability data, indicators, and initiatives (ESG) in their business models. To achieve this, we develop market-leading sustainability management software as plug-and-play SaaS for SMEs, financial institutions, and enterprises. We believe in fostering a culture of Collaboration to help our clients transition to this new approach, with each team member playing an integral part in our Mission-Driven ethos.




At C-MORE, we don’t want to only accept differences. We want to celebrate the difference and see beyond the obvious. C-More is proud to be an equal opportunity company, that does not discriminate against race, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, disability, or gender identity.




We Embrace a Culture of Collaboration, Mission-Driven, Openness, Responsibility, and Excellence

Title: Software Engineer
text:
🚀 Join Our Team at Agentero!




We’re on the lookout for a talented Software Engineer!




At Agentero we believe in simple and smart solutions for complex problems.




We are building cutting-edge technology to help insurance agents serve their customers more effectively and help them grow their business. We do so through a data driven platform that provides insurance agents with market access to digital carriers.




Agentero is a remote-first Silicon Valley startup with a top talent team spread across Spain and the US. We've raised a $13.5M Series A, bringing our total funding to over $20M with participation of top investors like Foundation Capital (Uber, Netflix) or USV (Twitter, MongoDB) and Mundi Ventures (WeFox). It’s going to be huge! This is just the start…




👤We Are Looking For




We're in search of a skilled Software Engineer who will play a vital role in shaping Agentero's technological landscape. This role entails crafting innovative solutions, coding with precision, and collaborating across teams to drive our software projects forward.




📣Being a Software Engineer At Agentero Means




You will write clean, robust, and performant software using Go Programming Language.
You will collaborate with our Product team to find creative solutions and deliver new features that delight our customers.
You will help us build a culture of engineering excellence that you are proud to belong to.




🛠You Would Say You Have




At least 3 years of relevant software development experience using any modern programming language.
Ownership of your work and enjoy the autonomy of being able to manage your projects across the different stages of software development: design, implementation, release management and production.
Great team player: humble, empathetic, open mindset.
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English.




🌟Bonus Points If You Have




Go Programming Language experience is preferred, but if you don't have experience with Go and you are a quick learner that is passionate about learning Go, we encourage you to apply.




💎What’s In It For You




Competitive salary (45k-60k depending on experience).
Stock Options. Own a part of the company.
Budget for training and development
Home office set-up budget
Restaurant and transport cards through Cobee
Private Health Insurance
Flexible working hours in a remote-first environment




🗓️What To Expect From Our Recruitment Process




We know recruitment process’ can be tedious, so here’s what ours looks like:




Initial Call with the People Team to get to know you
Role Specific Call with the Department Head to dive deeper into the nitty gritty
Technical Test and/or Case Study to put your skills to the test
Peer Call with a fellow team member to make sure the vibe is right
CEO call with our Founder, Luis Pino




If you’re ready to make a meaningful impact and contribute to our exciting journey, we invite you to apply today. Let’s shape the future of insurance together! 🚀

text:
